Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We power people’s progress.

At Preply, we’re all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it’s creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.

Meet The Team

At Preply, we’re reimagining the way we support language learning!

Our B2B team is at the forefront of enabling global companies to unlock language skills across their workforces. As our B2B offering continues to grow, we’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst - Insights to join our team and support our data driven decision-making.

You’ll be part of the Data chapter and embedded in the B2B squad, working alongside a senior data scientist, analytical engineer, and analytics manager. The role is ideal for someone who already has an analytical foundation and is eager to learn, grow, and make an impact in a dynamic and varied business environment.

We have an outstanding data science organization: we work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, data visualisation, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.

What You’ll Be Doing


Discover insights and inform the B2B team by running queries and extracting data using SQL and spreadsheets
Help build, improve and maintain data visualisations and reports to track B2B performance
Collaborate with the team on analyses related to customer success, product usage, and sales goals
Gain a deep understanding of B2B business metrics and use data to identify patterns or areas for improvement
Partner with your manager and peers to build skills and grow your analytical toolkit
Measure the impact of initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and iterate our strategy
Create reporting that the team can use to evaluate and track business performance and take action upon


What You Need To Succeed


Some experience in the data science & analytics field (around 1-2 years' experience or internships preferably)
Strong working knowledge of SQL for querying and data exploration
Comfortable with spreadsheets (Google Sheets or Excel), including functions, charts, and pivot tables
Some experience with data visualisation (can be in any tool)
Some knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Some coding skills in one or more analytics languages (Python, SQL, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills, and interest in learning about business context and impact
Good written and verbal communication skills - B1 English is a must


Nice To Have


University degree in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field (or equivalent business experience).
Experience working in startups, tech, or digital B2B environments
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Basic knowledge of business metrics like retention, conversion, or usage patterns
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).


Why You’ll Love It At Preply


An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles


Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.


Show more

  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Ubicación:

Madrid, ES, 28046

Fecha de publicación: 3 sept 2025

¿Te defines por tu talento y tu visión?

Entonces, tú también puedes marcar la diferencia. Únete a un entorno profesional que contribuye a la transformación de empresas y sociedad. Alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites y únete a una firma que va más allá de los servicios profesionales.

Porque marcar la diferencia no es solo algo que decimos. Es lo que hacemos.

Desarrolla tu carrera con nosotros.

En KPMG K-TIA (Tecnología e Innovación en Auditoría) contamos con un equipo excepcional, una amplia gama de servicios y de recursos tecnológicos adecuados, una potente red global y una clara estrategia para llegar al mercado. Por ello, nuestro equipo de Auditoría IT se encuentra en un proceso de expansión y captación de talento.

Actualmente, nos encontramos un/a analista de datos senior para el departamento.

¿Qué podrás hacer?


Realizar pruebas de D&A en los trabajos de auditoría, siendo capaz de entregar un resultado de calidad y ajustado a los tiempos de ejecución esperados.
Desarrollo de soluciones en PowerBI en base a necesidades.


¿Qué necesitas saber?


Titulación: Grado en Ingeniería o ADE (valorable especialización en D&A).
Al menos 2-3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos contables.
Conocimientos técnicos necesario: Excel avanzado, SQL básico, PowerBI avanzado.
Valorable experiencia en puesto similar, autonomía, capacidad para identificar necesidades y generar soluciones adecuadas.


¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?


Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formacióncontinuay plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas


Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Scalapay, we’re shaping a culture with high standards, independent and critical thought, innovation, ownership, and continuous learning. We operate in a fast-moving, tech-driven environment, and we’re looking for people who thrive in change, think boldly, and take initiative.

If you’re ready to put your potential to the test in a hiring process designed to spotlight exceptional talent, this is your chance to stand out and grow with one of Europe’s most ambitious fintech teams.

#MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay’s key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:

  • Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support;
  • Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement;
  • Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making;
  • Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights;
  • Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data;
  • Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes;
  • Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation;
  • Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay;
  • Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.

You’ll be great for this role if:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech;
  • You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus;
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling;
  • You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses;
  • You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way;
  • You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas;
  • You’re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!

Why you should join Scalapay:

  • Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000€ (Gross Annual Base);
  • International environment with significant challenges to be met every day;
  • Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences;
  • Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
  • Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.

Recruitment Process:

  • Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team;
  • Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role;
  • Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders;
  • Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay’s values and assess cultural alignment.

Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Cloud & BI Solutions)




Do you enjoy turning business challenges into data-driven insights? Are you comfortable working with stakeholders, analyzing datasets, and guiding others in their growth? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to strengthen our team and help shape impactful, cloud-based data solutions.




What you’ll be doing:

Work closely with business stakeholders to understand processes and translate their needs into clear data requirements.
Frame business questions into testable hypotheses that lead to real insights.
Prepare and analyze datasets, collaborating with data engineers and modelers to create scalable solutions.
Apply data modeling approaches (both dimensional and relational) to support reporting and analytics.
Design compelling data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Power BI.
Contribute to the development of new data propositions and analytical frameworks.




What you bring:

A completed WO or HBO degree (technical background preferred) with academic-level thinking and problem-solving ability.
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a consultancy role involving data-driven projects.
Experience working with SQL (Python and/or R is a plus).
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools.
Experience with project methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, or DevOps is an advantage.
Fluency in Dutch and English.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?

Neotalent Conclusion es una de las mayores especialistas del mercado ibérico en captación y gestión de talento informático y de ingeniería. Como parte del grupo neerlandés Conclusion, que se compone por un ecosistema de 25 empresas y 3.600 empleados, nos centramos en aumentar la capacidad tecnológica de nuestros clientes y acelerar la transformación digital de los mismos.

En Neotalent Conclusion, somos especialistas del talento. Atraemos a los mejores profesionales y los combinamos con los proyectos más ambiciosos, en el momento justo. Nuestro éxito radica en la inversión en innovación, orientación a resultados y, por encima de todo, en la garantía de que las personas tengan carreras felices y realizadoras.




Con más de 25 años de experiencia, Neotalent Conclusion cuenta con oficinas en Madrid, Lisboa y Oporto. Nuestra compañía está formada por un equipo de más de 850 profesionales entre sus diferentes áreas de operación.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Más información en www.neotalent.pt/es y https://neotalent.pt/es/oportunidades-de-carrera/.




📝 Descripción del puesto

En Neotalent Conclusion buscamos un Data Analyst Junior para unirse al equipo de Data & Analytics. La persona seleccionada apoyará en proyectos de Gobierno del Dato, contribuyendo al análisis, gestión y visualización de información clave para que las decisiones de negocio se basen en datos fiables, estructurados y de calidad.

Aunque no es imprescindible, se valorará experiencia en Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

.

🎯 Responsabilidades

Participar en la recogida, limpieza y transformación de datos desde distintas fuentes.
Colaborar en la creación de reportes y dashboards para diferentes áreas de negocio.
Contribuir a proyectos de Data Governance, asegurando consistencia y calidad de los datos.
Apoyar en la definición de KPIs y métricas clave.
Trabajar junto a analistas senior y equipos de Data Science en proyectos estratégicos.
Mantener la documentación de procesos y flujos de datos.




✅ Requisitos

2–3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos y proyectos de Gobierno del Dato.
Conocimientos de SQL y herramientas de análisis.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Google Data Studio u otras).
Valorable experiencia con Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y buenas habilidades de comunicación.
Residencia en Madrid.




🌟 Qué ofrecemos

Flexibilidad: trabajo remoto con opción de acudir a oficina en Madrid.
Work-life balance: jornada intensiva de junio a septiembre.
Oportunidad de participar en proyectos estratégicos de Data & Analytics y Gobierno del Dato.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
En Metrica somos una empresa líder en servicios de consultoría tecnológica con más de 20 años de experiencia, especializada en el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras y personalizadas para grandes organizaciones.




Actualmente estamos seleccionando un Analista de Datos al menos 3 años de experiencia para unirse a un importante cliente internacional del sector bancario.




🎯 Requisitos obligatorios:

Alta de operaciones en Murex.
Mantenimiento de cartera viva de notas estructuradas.
Conocimiento financiero ligado a instrumentos de crédito.
Manejo de Python y SQL
Inglés alto

📚 Formación continua gratuita, porque apostamos por tu crecimiento profesional.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
Welcome To The World Of Whizdom!




Pourquoi les développeurs NoSQL ne vont pas au restaurant ❓

WHIZE a la réponse: https://lnkd.in/dkC5Rb2Q




Whize est une filiale du groupe Neurones (7000 collaborateurs en France), spécialisée dans le domaine de la Data Intelligence et du développement de solutions sur mesure en architecture Serverless. Notre positionnement se décline en 3 offres :




Modern BI : expertise sur toute la chaine décisionnelle (Power BI, Tableau, AZURE Data Factory....)
Data Engineering : Manipulation et préparation de la Data en utilisation Python et SQL avancé.
Développement en Cloud Native: : développement d'applications (.Net, Java, Node.js, Python) basées sur les services managés du Cloud (AWS, Azure ou GCP)




Vos missions :

En tant que Data Analyst Power BI, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans la compréhension et l’exploitation des données pour éclairer les décisions stratégiques. Vous interviendrez sur :

Recueillir et analyser les besoins auprès des équipes métier et de la direction
Identifier, définir et suivre les indicateurs clés de performance (KPI)
Préparer, nettoyer et transformer les données avec Power Query pour garantir leur fiabilité
Concevoir des tableaux de bord clairs, interactifs et visuellement impactants dans Power BI
Réaliser des analyses approfondies pour détecter tendances, corrélations et anomalies
Produire des insights actionnables et formuler des recommandations concrètes
Mettre en place des rapports favorisant l’exploration autonome des données par les utilisateurs
Accompagner et former les équipes dans l’interprétation des résultats et la prise de décision basée sur la donnée
Contribuer à la diffusion d’une culture data-driven au sein de l’entrepris




Profil recherché:

Expérience en analyse de données ou Business Intelligence
Maîtrise de Power BI, Power Query et du langage DAX
Solides compétences en analyse et interprétation de données
Bonne maîtrise de SQL pour l’extraction et la préparation des données
Capacité à vulgariser des résultats complexes et à pratiquer le data storytelling
Sens du service, esprit d’équipe et aisance relationnelle




Qu’attendez-vous pour nous rejoindre ?

Vous ferez partie d’une société à taille humaine et qui bénéficie des avantages d'un grand groupe. Nous adressons une centaine de clients en direct dont la moitié sont des grands comptes.
Vous serez accompagné(e) et managé(e) par le CEO de WHIZE (THE WHIZE MAN).
Vous allez compléter notre équipe dynamique et travailler avec nous dans une ambiance Start-up et conviviale.
Vous occuperez des postes intéressants et évolutifs.
Vous bénéficierez des évènements internes organisés pour parler tech, business et projets.
Vous réaliserez des projets à forte valeur ajoutée.




📍 : Neuilly-Sur-Seine+ 2/3 jours de Télétravail

Title: Junior Panel Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

Job Description

Mission of the role:


The position is responsible for classification and identification of the provided information in order to systematize and recognize
Process the information with predefined requirements in order to be used from other teams/client in the next stages of data processing
This role has responsibility for meeting the deadlines of preparing the information with maximum performance, depending on the nature of the tasks


You will:


Perform data-in activities for the business
Meet the agreed daily/weekly/monthly targets and deadlines
Meet or exceed productivity benchmarks
Maintain consistent high level of quality
Align data-in activities with standard global procedures and documents
Attend meetings/discussions with country representatives when required
Attend training when required
Report any known errors or discrepancies to direct manager
Provide support and execute different additional tasks supporting the data-in process


You have:


University degree in: Economics, Mathematics, Information Technology, Data Management or other related area
Good knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
Working level of English (B1 - B2)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to identify and understand problems
Ability to work under pressure of deadlines and targets


Benefits:


Exciting work environment that brings people together

Initial and ongoing trainings to support your development

Health insurance
Last but not least – GfK Sofia office is located close to the city center and easily accessible from any point by public transportation – 47A Tsarisgradsko Shose Blvd

Job Description

Mission of the role:

  • The position is responsible for classification and identification of the provided information in order to systematize and recognize
  • Process the information with predefined requirements in order to be used from other teams/client in the next stages of data processing
  • This role has responsibility for meeting the deadlines of preparing the information with maximum performance, depending on the nature of the tasks

You will:

  • Perform data-in activities for the business
  • Meet the agreed daily/weekly/monthly targets and deadlines
  • Meet or exceed productivity benchmarks
  • Maintain consistent high level of quality
  • Align data-in activities with standard global procedures and documents
  • Attend meetings/discussions with country representatives when required
  • Attend training when required
  • Report any known errors or discrepancies to direct manager
  • Provide support and execute different additional tasks supporting the data-in process

You have:

  • University degree in: Economics, Mathematics, Information Technology, Data Management or other related area
  • Good knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
  • Working level of English (B1 - B2)
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to identify and understand problems
  • Ability to work under pressure of deadlines and targets

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben bei uns


Your responsibilities





Manage and analyze large datasets from multiple sources (SQL databases, Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, etc.)


Automate recurring reporting processes (Google Sheets, Looker Studio, etc.) and reduce manual work


Build dashboards and reporting pipelines that provide clear insights into campaign and funnel performance


Conduct advanced statistical analysis (regressions, predictive models, machine learning approaches, attribution models) to uncover insights and optimize decision-making


Support the team in developing and refining a multi-touch attribution model


Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure data accuracy and transparency across all channels



Das bringst Du mit


Your profile





Strong background in data analysis with excellent SQL skills


Solid understanding of marketing metrics and KPIs (especially in paid performance marketing)


Experience in automating data workflows (Python, R, or similar is a plus)


Knowledge of statistical methods, regressions, or machine learning techniques (plus)


Hands-on experience with data visualization and reporting tools (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar)


A structured and detail-oriented working style with a passion for solving complex problems


Proficiency in English; German is a plus but not required



Das bieten wir Dir


What we offer





A chance to make a real impact in healthcare recruiting


A dynamic and fast-growing environment with room to take ownership


Collaboration with a passionate and international team


Hybrid work model from our Berlin office


Competitive salary and development opportunities





As Marketing Data Analyst at Pflegia, you will be the go-to person for everything related to marketing data. You will structure, analyze, and automate our reporting processes to enable data-driven decision-making at scale. You will work closely with our performance marketing and product teams, but your main focus will be data analysis and automation rather than campaign management.




At Pflegia, our mission is to transform the healthcare recruiting industry by connecting qualified nursing professionals with the right employers faster and more efficiently. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to strengthen our marketing team with deep expertise in data, automation, and advanced analytics.

Show more

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to strengthen our marketing team with deep expertise in data, automation, and advanced analytics.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Zeal Group is one of the leading trading platforms with a focus on developing markets and great plans for international expansion.

At the heart of our company's data-driven strategy lies our Business Intelligence team, a specialized group dedicated to the art and science of data analysis. Our team is the backbone in transforming raw data into a treasure trove of insights, guiding the strategic direction of the company. With a laser focus on identifying and building key indicators for crucial areas within the organization, we strive to help key stakeholders in strategic decision-making.

We are a compact team of data analysts and BI engineers, each with a deep understanding of how data shapes business outcomes. Our expertise spans across various domains, enabling us to craft bespoke analytical solutions that meet the unique needs of different departments. From sales and marketing to operations and finance, our work informs strategies, optimizes performance, and uncovers opportunities for growth and innovation.

In our pursuit of excellence, we leverage cutting-edge BI tools and technologies, ensuring our stakeholders access reliable, timely, and actionable data. Our collaborative ethos fosters a culture of shared knowledge and continuous learning, enabling us to push the boundaries of what is possible with data.

As a Data Analyst/BI Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations. Your mission is to delve deep into the analysis of company indicators, unraveling the stories the data tells to empower business decisions, optimize processes, and drive product innovation. You will:


Analyze company indicators to provide actionable business insights and product improvement recommendations
Develop and own business intelligence solutions, including BI/data visualisation tools, dashboards, and reports to meet business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders as a data business partner, understanding and defining business requirements for data assets
Develop and maintain the semantics layers of the data analytics platform through effective data modelling and data orchestration
Ensure data quality and integrity by establishing and enforcing data governance standards
Create and manage documentation, including technical specifications, data catalog, and other related documents for BI processes, systems, and procedures



Requirements


Fluency in SQL is a must (CTE, Window functions)
Hands-on experience with BI tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualizations (Power BI, Metabase or similar tools)
Proven track record of end-to-end implementation of data analysis projects, from gathering requirements and data processing to effectively presenting insights to stakeholders
Proficient in data modeling, building high quality datasets and products


Nice to have


Proficiency in Data Modelling, building high quality datasets and products
Experience in Python
Experience with DBT, Airflow, Dagster or similar tools
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Spark)
Background in online trading or related financial sectors



Benefits


State-of-the-art technologies (Power BI, Metabase, BigQuery, Dagster, DBT, Datahub, Spark, Python, SQL)
A collaborative and friendly team of professionals
High engineering standards (with a focus on change management and data quality)
Flexible schedule and remote friendliness
Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Power BI
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?

Neotalent Conclusion es una de las mayores especialistas del mercado ibérico en captación y gestión de talento informático y de ingeniería. Como parte del grupo neerlandés Conclusion, que se compone por un ecosistema de 25 empresas y 3.600 empleados, nos centramos en aumentar la capacidad tecnológica de nuestros clientes y acelerar la transformación digital de los mismos.

En Neotalent Conclusion, somos especialistas del talento. Atraemos a los mejores profesionales y los combinamos con los proyectos más ambiciosos, en el momento justo. Nuestro éxito radica en la inversión en innovación, orientación a resultados y, por encima de todo, en la garantía de que las personas tengan carreras felices y realizadoras.




Con más de 25 años de experiencia, Neotalent Conclusion cuenta con oficinas en Madrid, Lisboa y Oporto. Nuestra compañía está formada por un equipo de más de 850 profesionales entre sus diferentes áreas de operación.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Más información en www.neotalent.pt/es y https://neotalent.pt/es/oportunidades-de-carrera/.




En Neotalent Conclusion, buscamos incorporar un/a Senior Data Analyst para trabajar con nuestro cliente del sector de seguros




Esta es una excelente oportunidad para profesionales con perfil técnico y pasión por los datos que deseen evolucionar en un entorno ágil, innovador y colaborativo.




Cuáles serán tus funciones:

Administración y mantenimiento de la plataforma de Business Intelligence Soporte y mentoría al equipo
Desarrollo de tableros y reportes para monitoreo y toma de decisiones
Administración y mantenimiento de la plataforma de Business Intelligence
Soporte y mentoría al equipo
Desarrollo de tableros y reportes para monitoreo y toma de decisiones
Reportes y tableros (dashboards)




Qué perfil buscamos:

Experiencia en la administración de Power BI Premium, visualización y modelado de datos.
Soporte a usuarios de datos y mentoría.
Inglés B2-C1. Trabajarás en colaboración con un equipo internacional, por lo que hablar en inglés es indispensable para la posición.




Habilidades técnicas requeridas:

Power BI Premium
DAX
SQL
Python
Azure DevOps
Azure Databricks
Excel
PowerPoint




Valoramos positivamente:

Microsoft Fabric
Aspectos de seguridad, redes y gobernanza




Por qué unirte a nosotros:

Trabajar en proyectos desafiantes para grandes clientes
Modalidad de trabajo: Híbrida en Barcelona, 2 días presenciales, 3 teletrabajo.
Contrato Indefinido con Neotalent Conclusion
Aprender más sobre tecnologías emergentes
Posibilidad de trabajar de forma remota
Acceso a formación continua y certificaciones
Disfrutar de un plan de compensación flexible
... ¡y mucho más!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Dow Jones Barcelona Job ID About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

This role will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. This position will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will


Develop partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Build data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.
Build a thorough understanding of all the B2C data sources that we use in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and consistently organize data.
Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and refine processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency
Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Up to 2 years of experience in similar roles.
The ability to own your projects proactively and coordinate with multiple stakeholders.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience with SQL and knowledge of Excel/Sheets. Familiarity with Github, Python/R.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc.)
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics).


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans for you and your family (paid by Dow Jones)
Extra paid Time Off (30 days of holidays/year)
Possibility to work remotely for 3 months/year (desplazamiento program) or one week of remote work per quarter
Meal benefit with Pluxee (171€/month on top of your salary)
Retirement Plans (Dow Jones will pay 2% of a members Pensionable Salary and match employee contribution up to a maximum of 3 %).
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Well-being Resources (200 USD allowance per quarter, Classpass, etc.)
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role, based in Barcelona.

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Technology

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Req ID: 48621

  • Possibility to work remotely for 3 months/year (desplazamiento program) or one week of remote work per quarter
  • Meal benefit with Pluxee (171€/month on top of your salary)
  • Retirement Plans (Dow Jones will pay 2% of a members Pensionable Salary and match employee contribution up to a maximum of 3 %).
  • Comprehensive Insurance Plans
  • Well-being Resources (200 USD allowance per quarter, Classpass, etc.)
  • Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
  • Subscription Discounts
  • Employee Referral Program

\

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role, based in Barcelona.

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Technology

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Req ID: 48621

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For 30 years, the incredible minds at Cognyte around the world have worked closely together and put their expertise to work to keep up with constantly evolving technological and criminal trends, and help make the world a safer place with leading investigative analytics software solutions.

We are defined by our dedication to doing good, and this translates to business success, meaningful work friendships, a can-do attitude, and deep curiosity.

As a Cognyter you will:

Analyze large and complex datasets across departments (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, etc.) to identify trends, issues, and actionable insights
Translate business needs into structured data analysis, delivering impactful dashboards, reports, and recommendations
Support strategic decision-making through business intelligence tools and data storytelling
Partner with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven initiatives across the organization
Collaborate with IT and GTM teams to evaluate current Salesforce (SFDC) usage, identify workflow gaps, and enhance CRM-related processes
Help design, document, and implement improvements in Salesforce to increase efficiency, automation, and data integrity
Act as a bridge between business and technical teams to ensure CRM updates meet operational needs
Maintain high data quality and governance standards within Salesforce
Provide user training and support change management for Salesforce process updates




For that mission, you’ll need:

3+ years of experience in a data analyst role with a strong focus on data-driven insights and CRM optimization
Hands-on experience with Salesforce (SFDC), including workflows, reports, dashboards, and data governance
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to collaborate with both technical and business stakeholders
High attention to detail and a passion for turning data into meaningful business outcomes
Fluent English (spoken and written); additional languages – an advantage
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or similar); advanced degree – an advantage







Remember: When you're curious enough, you don't need to check every box to apply. Be in touch!

We believe that diverse teams drive the greatness of ideas, products, and companies. Whatever your gender, age, race, creed, or taste in music – if you're curious enough, we’re waiting for you. Apply now.

Title: CRM Data Analyst - Nespresso
Description:
Descrierea pozitiei

Cautam un coleg / o colega care sa sprijine buna desfasurare a celor doua linii de business Nespresso, B2C si B2B, prin realizarea de rapoarte si analize de clienti si vanzari, de campanii pentru clienti si de campanii de E-mail Marketing.

O zi obisnuita ar decurge astfel:


Propui, identifici, creezi si obtii rapoarte pentru evaluarea comportamentului clientilor Nespresso, B2B si B2C, a vanzarilor si a campaniilor pentru clienti.
Realizezi prezentari interne privind rezultatele campaniilor.
Evaluezi Best Practices CRM disponibile la nivel international si coordonezi activitatea pentru obtinerea de rapoarte si insight-uri relevante pe plan local.
Oferi sprijin in propunerea, gestionarea și evaluarea calendarului anual cu activitati CRM: promotii si campanii pentru reactivare, prevenire inactivare, crestere frecventa, crestere comanda de cafea, loializare etc.
Setezi mecanismele promotionale in Neosoft.
Oferi sprijin catre B2C & CRM Manager la estimarea de volume si de KPIs de CRM la nivel de luna.
Realizezi analiza competitiva si cercetarile de piata pentru a identifica oportunitati de crestere.
Monitorizezi tendintele din industrie si comportamentul consumatorilor pentru a sustine planificarea strategica.
Construiesti rapoarte in sistemul de gestionare a bazei de date (SAP HANA, Snowflake, Knime, Power BI) si sprijini departamentele Nespresso.


Cum poti avea succes?


Foarte bune cunostinte MS Office: Excel, Power Point
Cunostinte avansate de limba engleza
Cunostinte SQL, BI
Studii superioare finalizate
Cunoasterea / intelegerea principiilor de marketing
Excelente abilitati de comunicare si relationare


Ce oferim?


O cultura axata pe incluziune, diversitate si inovatie
Mediu de lucru international
Tichete de masa
Bonus de performanta
Bonusuri de Craciun si de Paste
Abonament medical pentru angajatii nostri, sot/sotie si copiii lor
Bookster
PetWork
Programe "Mental health"
Zile de concediu suplimentare care cresc odata cu vechimea la Nestle
Espressor Nespresso si ratie lunara de capsule Nespresso.


#Nespresso

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Fully Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time Contractor




About Us:




Bitcoinsensus is a leading entity in the cryptocurrency space, committed to sharing knowledge through multiple social media platforms and our website. We’re focused on real-time market analysis, comprehensive guides, industry news, and insightful reviews, serving a diverse audience ranging from blockchain and crypto beginners to experts.




Role Overview:

We’re seeking a skilled Data Analyst who can turn raw data into actionable insights. The role requires a deep understanding of how to work with complex datasets, identify trends, and communicate key findings to influence strategic decisions.




Key Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and interpret large datasets to uncover actionable insights.
Work with the engineering team to develop out the entire infrastructure to support the company’s data needs
Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools such as Mixpanel, Tableau, Power BI, Superset or Looker.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business growth.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define KPIs and measure performance.
Support data-driven decision-making processes through data storytelling and by providing clear and concise recommendations.
Provide key reports, trends & insights that will enable the business to implement strategic & commercial decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across projects.




Qualifications & Skills

Please read below fully as a candidate that does not meet the requirements will not be considered:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
A demonstrated commercial mindset and understanding on how to translate data & insights into critical business & commercial decisions is a must.
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Excellent communication skills to convey insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.




What We Offer

Salary that is based on your experience and skill set
Fully remote work setting
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin’s Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you’re passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team and will be reporting to our Director of Data & Analytics. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flexible working hours: 40-hour workweek with start times between 8 AM and 10 AM (or from 7:30 AM when working onsite to avoid traffic jams), and early leave from 4 PM (Fridays from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 210€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.
Show more

  • Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
  • Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
  • Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
  • Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.

Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join The Game!

Leader in the development and publishing of games, Gameloft® has established itself as a pioneer in the industry, creating innovative gaming experiences for over 20 years. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, from mobile to cross-platform titles for PC and consoles. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Dragon Mania Legends, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including LEGO®, Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel®, Lamborghini®, and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 3,000 people worldwide. Every month, 55 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft for brands, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company. 



In collaboration with Product Managers, Game Economy Designers, Game Designers, Marketing Managers the Data Analyst will collect, clean, analyze, and automatize data exploitation process. The Data Analyst will have to model, predict, segment vast amounts of data from our customers. Last but not least, the Data Analyst will work with an international team of data experts, share knowledge, and contribute to the data technical data team skill increase.

As Data Analyst in Gameloft Sofia your role would be to


Build both large systematic reports and one-off small pieces of analysis
Provide on-going reporting and performance monitoring from multiple data sources
Create and update SQL computer programs for game analysis
Collaborate to the development of interactive applications for data mining and visualization
Proactively develop new analyses and insights, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization
Debug and solve issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics



Significant experience performing quantitative analysis, preferably for an Internet or technology company
B.S. or B.A. in math, BI, economics, engineering or other technical field required
Excellent SQL skills extensive experience querying large, complex datasets
Excellent Data Visualization skills
Ability to create complex data flows and algorithms
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Enjoy working in both individual and team settings
Working English is desirable
Strong interest for video games


Considered a plus


Experience with Python/R
Experience with Looker, Power BI, Tableau
Understanding of advanced statistical methodologies
Understanding of business models and monetization strategies


Why Join Gameloft Universe?


You want to work in an exceptional industry and create games downloaded by millions of players every day
You want to be part of a talented and supportive team of pioneers who have a passion for creating video games
You want to contribute to a vibrant and dynamic atmosphere
You want to join a global company and meet great people around the world
You are looking for a fun place to work in the heart of Sofia and excellent transport connections
You want to work on a permanent contract with competitive remuneration and benefits package


Our Benefits


Additional Health Insurance with excellent coverage, including dental care & dioptric glasses reimbursement
Flexible working time on hybrid mode with short Friday option
Food vouchers – 200 lv. per month
Several options for active lifestyle – both Multisport and Coolfit cards available
20 days paid annual leave + 1 birthday day off
Referral & Baby Bonus
Modern & Cozy office in Sofia Tower 2 (Mall of Sofia) with a lot of gaming temptations – table tennis, air hockey, PS5, great board games collection, etc.
Hot beverages at your disposal on daily basis + fresh fruits & snacks on weekly
Access to office library, trainings and career development plan
Active studio life – different events, parties, charity initiatives and more
Occasional Gifts – celebrate special moments
Exclusive discount program from retailers, restaurants, tech suppliers and more


If you are interested in our job offer, please send a CV. Applications will be processed in confidentiality.
Show more

  • Create and update SQL computer programs for game analysis
  • Collaborate to the development of interactive applications for data mining and visualization
  • Proactively develop new analyses and insights, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization
  • Debug and solve issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics


  • Significant experience performing quantitative analysis, preferably for an Internet or technology company
  • B.S. or B.A. in math, BI, economics, engineering or other technical field required
  • Excellent SQL skills extensive experience querying large, complex datasets
  • Excellent Data Visualization skills
  • Ability to create complex data flows and algorithms
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
  • Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
  • Enjoy working in both individual and team settings
  • Working English is desirable
  • Strong interest for video games

Considered a plus

  • Experience with Python/R
  • Experience with Looker, Power BI, Tableau
  • Understanding of advanced statistical methodologies
  • Understanding of business models and monetization strategies


Why Join Gameloft Universe?

  • You want to work in an exceptional industry and create games downloaded by millions of players every day
  • You want to be part of a talented and supportive team of pioneers who have a passion for creating video games
  • You want to contribute to a vibrant and dynamic atmosphere
  • You want to join a global company and meet great people around the world
  • You are looking for a fun place to work in the heart of Sofia and excellent transport connections
  • You want to work on a permanent contract with competitive remuneration and benefits package

Our Benefits

  • Additional Health Insurance with excellent coverage, including dental care & dioptric glasses reimbursement
  • Flexible working time on hybrid mode with short Friday option
  • Food vouchers – 200 lv. per month
  • Several options for active lifestyle – both Multisport and Coolfit cards available
  • 20 days paid annual leave + 1 birthday day off
  • Referral & Baby Bonus
  • Modern & Cozy office in Sofia Tower 2 (Mall of Sofia) with a lot of gaming temptations – table tennis, air hockey, PS5, great board games collection, etc.
  • Hot beverages at your disposal on daily basis + fresh fruits & snacks on weekly
  • Access to office library, trainings and career development plan
  • Active studio life – different events, parties, charity initiatives and more
  • Occasional Gifts – celebrate special moments
  • Exclusive discount program from retailers, restaurants, tech suppliers and more

If you are interested in our job offer, please send a CV. Applications will be processed in confidentiality.

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data & Business Intelligence Analyst on a contract basis to support ongoing reporting, dashboard development, and data-cleaning initiatives. This role will help relieve backlog in our analytics pipeline, assist with data validation, and accelerate delivery of dashboards and recurring reports. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, data-curious, and comfortable with common BI tools and SQL.

Your future duties and responsibilities


Support the creation and maintenance of Power BI or Tableau dashboards
Perform data cleaning, transformation, and validation across key datasets
Write SQL queries for extracting and analyzing data
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Automate and streamline recurring Excel or BI reports
Assist with data audits and quality checks
Document key processes for handover or team integration


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Nice-to-Have Skills:


Basic knowledge of Python for data (pandas, Jupyter)
Experience with Google Sheets, Looker Studio, or cloud data sources


Previous contract work or experience in fast-paced environments

Required Skills & Qualifications:


1–2 years of experience in a data analyst or BI support role (internship or freelance acceptable)
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and/or Tableau
Solid knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Understanding of data cleaning and reporting workflows
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines
Good communication skills and a proactive, collaborative mindset


Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.


Show more

Data Analyst - Contract

Rate: €400/day

Duration: Until end of December 2025

Commitment: ~20 hours/week

Location: Remote (some travel may be required)

Explore data creatively to identify correlations and patterns

Experience generating analytical insights and storytelling from data

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Faites un pas en avant et laissez-vous surprendre par Edenred.

Chaque jour, nous fournissons des solutions innovantes pour améliorer la vie de millions de personnes, en connectant les employés, les entreprises et les commerçants dans le monde entier.

Nous savons qu'il y a des centaines de façons pour vous d'évoluer. Avec nous, vous développerez vos compétences dans un environnement multiculturel, stimulant et dynamique.




Osez rejoindre Edenred et préparez-vous à vous épanouir dans une entreprise internationale qui vous offrira des opportunités infinies.




La méritocratie fait partie de notre ADN.

Chez Edenred, nous reconnaissons, recrutons et développons tous les talents.

Venez comme vous êtes, dans le respect de votre singularité et contribuer à l'aventure Edenred avec nous.

Nous nous engageons à prévenir toute forme de discrimination et à proposer à tous nos candidats des opportunités égales indépendamment de leur genre et expression de genre, handicap, origine, croyance religieuse et orientation sexuelle ou tout autre critère.







Au sein de la Direction Partenaires Marchands, nous recherchons notre futur Data Analyst H/F en CDI à Montrouge (92) pour rejoindre l’équipe de Mahdi, Directeur Process & Data.




Votre impact




En mode agile, vous mettez en place des outils de suivi des données, et définissez les analyses stratégiques nécessaires pour la Direction Marchands.

Vous êtes en charge de comprendre les besoins métiers qui vous sont remontés, produire et suivre les reporting décisionnels en interne.




Vos missions :

Définition des indicateurs clés de performance en lien avec les acteurs de la direction.
Conception de tableaux de bord de suivi de la performance et des outils de reporting
Optimisation des outils d'analyse et mise à disposition des équipes Métiers
Représentation de la Direction Marchands France dans les instances Data de l’Entreprise
Participation aux projets impactant la Data




Vos expériences et compétences qui feront votre succès :




Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 3 ans minimum sur un poste similaire.

Vous maitrisez PowerBI et SQL.

Idéalement, vous avez déjà utilisé DataBricks et Python, et travaillé dans une structure de grande taille.







C’est aussi votre savoir-être qui prime :




🔎 Grâce à vos capacités d'analyse, rien ne vous échappe ! Vous êtes rigoureux et avez le sens de l’organisation

📣 Vous êtes reconnu pour vos qualités de communiquant et votre capacité à embarquer vos interlocuteurs

🤝 Véritable team player, pour vous le travail d'équipe est synonyme de réussit

🚀 La satisfaction client est pour vous une priorité




Les petits plus qui font la différence #Vibewithus :

Télétravail : 2 jours par semaine (à partir de 3 mois d’ancienneté)
Nos avantages groupe : prime sur objectif, la carte ticket restaurant (11,97€ par jour, pris en charge à 60%), une prime d'intéressement et de participation, RTT, CSE, forfait mobilité, chèques Kadeos, & CESU.
Top Employer 2025, Edenred France, connait une croissance pérenne à 2 chiffres.
CAC 40 ESG, symbole de notre engagement envers une économie durable et responsable !
Parcours onboarding dédié, programme d’accompagnement skill+ par nos managers coach afin de garantir une montée en compétence et l’atteinte des objectifs.
Des événements qui enrichissent votre vie professionnelle et personnelle (séminaires, afterwork, programme sport & bien-être, ...)







Processus de recrutement




Intéressé ? Nous ferons au mieux pour d’être transparents et rapides !




1. Découvrons-nous (15 à 30’) avec le recruteur ?

2. Echangez avec votre futur manager et le directeur de la data (60’) dans nos bureaux

3. Rencontrez l’équipe (30’ à 60’)







#Dreamteam #Topemployer2025

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure’s growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role’s relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization’s growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly. 

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline. 

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously. 

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company’s DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative.
